item.title: Loose manhole cover driving residents insane!, 18th June
item.description:
There is a loose manhole cover directly outside my property, and this issue has been ongoing for over a year. Despite how long this has persisted, no lasting action has been taken to fix it. The cover is unstable and rattles loudly every time a vehicle drives over it. This happens dozens of times per day, and especially at night when traffic is lighter but ambient noise is low, the metal-on-metal clanging is extremely loud and disruptive. It has become a source of serious noise pollution, consistently disturbing sleep and contributing to stress and reduced wellbeing for me and others in the building. In addition to the noise, the loose cover presents a clear safety hazard. It poses a trip risk for pedestrians, especially children, elderly residents, and those with mobility impairments. It is also dangerous for cyclists or scooter users, who could easily lose control if the cover shifts under their wheels. For drivers, it can cause damage to vehicles over time. This manhole has been left in this condition for far too long, and the problem is only worsening. I am asking Southwark Council to treat this as an urgent repair issue, not only for public safety but also due to the ongoing negative impact on residents’ mental health and quality of life. I request that a repair team be dispatched to inspect and permanently secure or replace the manhole cover as soon as possible. Please confirm that this issue has been logged and advise what action will be taken and when.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Boundary Lane, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car dumped on private car park for residents only, 18th June
item.description:
Car has not moved for many months. Number plate is covered with tape. Car is dirty. Car park is for the residents that live in the adjacent flats only and their visitors only and is private land. Believe that the vehicle owner does not live in the flats on Greenhaven drive. There are now two cars dumped here both with registration numbers coveted with tape. Residents need the parking spaces.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenhaven Drive, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car dumped in car park that is on private land and is for the residents only, 18th June
item.description:
This vehicle was dumped here on 22 May 2025. The car park is for residents of the adjacent flats on Greenhaven Drive and their visitors only (as per visible signs in car park). The registration number is covered with tape. There are remains of a notice sticker with a yellow and black border which has been torn off of the driver side window which suggests the vehicle has been dumped elsewhere previously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenhaven Drive, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
